category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 39 (Prevention of Musculoskeletal Diseases)
contents: Article 39 (Prevention of Musculoskeletal Disorders) ① If there is a risk of musculoskeletal disorders occurring in workers due to work that burdens the musculoskeletal system, the Chairman of the Board of Directors shall establish management standards for the prevention of these diseases and provide training on the same. Revised December 22, 2021., ② If a worker is found to have a musculoskeletal disorder, the Chairman of the Board shall ensure that the worker receives appropriate medical care for health management., ③ If a worker returns to work after completing medical care in accordance with paragraph 2, The job can be switched to another job through consultation with the worker concerned. However, if it is difficult to switch jobs due to the nature of the work, appropriate measures must be taken, such as improving work posture and work environment.
